title: Rotational Motion - linear and angular velocity

content.description: A theme park ride consists of a large vertical wheel of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>R</mi></math> that rotates counterclockwise on a horizontal axle through its center, as shown. The cars on the wheel move at a constant speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>v</mi></math>. Points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi> </math> represent the position of a car at the highest and lowest point of the ride, respectively.
content.question:
A student is sitting in a seat in one of the cars as the ride rotates with a constant period. Which of the following correctly describes the linear and angular velocities of the student while passing point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>?
